file.create.name: file.create
file.create.title: Create File
file.create.description: Creates a new file at the specified path with the provided content. Automatically creates parent directories if they do not exist. Runs `goimports` to format the code and manage imports before saving. Defaults to overwrite mode.
file.create.instruction:
*   **`file.create`**: Create a new file from scratch.
    *   **Usage:** `file.create(name="cmd/main.go", content="package main\n...")`
    *   **Outcome:** File is created, formatted, and imports are organized. Parent directories are created automatically.

file.edit.name: file.edit
file.edit.title: Edit File (Smart)
file.edit.description: Modifies an existing Go file using fuzzy matching or appending. If `search_context` is provided, locates the block with the highest similarity score and replaces it. If `search_context` is empty, appends content to the end. Automatically formats code using `goimports` and verifies syntax before saving.
file.edit.instruction:
*   **`file.edit`**: Modify or append to an existing file.
    *   **Modify:** `file.edit(file="main.go", search_context="func old() {\n}", replacement="func new() {\n}")`
    *   **Append:** `file.edit(file="main.go", replacement="func newFunc() {\n}")` (Leave `search_context` empty)
    *   **Outcome:** Code is patched, formatted, and syntax-checked. If the match fails, you will receive the best match found to help you correct the context.

file.outline.name: file.outline
file.outline.title: File Outline
file.outline.description: Parses a Go source file and returns a skeleton containing imports, type definitions, and function signatures. Does not include function bodies. Useful for quickly assessing file structure with minimal token usage.
file.outline.instruction:
*   **`file.outline`**: Get the structure of a file without reading the entire body.
    *   **Usage:** `file.outline(file="pkg/service.go")`
    *   **Outcome:** Returns imports, type definitions, and function signatures. Use this to quickly navigate large files.

file.read.name: file.read
file.read.title: Read File
file.read.description: Reads and returns the complete content of a Go source file. Additionally extracts and lists a symbol table containing functions, types, and variables defined in the file.
file.read.instruction:
*   **`file.read`**: Read the full content of a file.
    *   **Usage:** `file.read(file_path="pkg/utils.go")`
    *   **Outcome:** Returns the complete file content and a list of defined symbols (functions, types).

file.list.name: file.list
file.list.title: List Files
file.list.description: Recursively lists files and directories starting from a specified root path. Supports depth limiting to manage output size.
file.list.instruction:
*   **`file.list`**: Explore the project structure.
    *   **Usage:** `file.list(path=".", depth=2)`
    *   **Outcome:** Lists files and directories up to the specified depth. Useful for discovering where code lives.

symbol.inspect.name: symbol.inspect
symbol.inspect.title: Inspect Symbol
symbol.inspect.description: Retrieves detailed information for a specific Go symbol, including its signature, source code definition, and documentation comments. Resolves symbols using the project's knowledge graph.
symbol.inspect.instruction:
*   **`symbol.inspect`**: Get the definition and documentation of a specific symbol.
    *   **Usage:** `symbol.inspect(package="fmt", symbol="Println")` or `symbol.inspect(file="main.go", symbol="MyFunc")`
    *   **Outcome:** Returns the source code, documentation, and location of the symbol. Essential for understanding how to use or modify existing code.

symbol.rename.name: symbol.rename
symbol.rename.title: Rename Symbol
symbol.rename.description: Renames a Go identifier (function, type, variable) and updates all references throughout the codebase using the `gopls` tool to ensure semantic correctness.
symbol.rename.instruction:
*   **`symbol.rename`**: Safely rename a symbol and update all references.
    *   **Usage:** `symbol.rename(file="pkg/user.go", line=10, col=5, new_name="Customer")`
    *   **Outcome:** The symbol is renamed globally, and all usages are updated. Prevents build errors caused by manual renaming.

project.map.name: project.map
project.map.title: Project Map
project.map.description: Generates a hierarchical map of the project structure, listing all local packages and their files, as well as a summary of external dependencies and standard library usage.
project.map.instruction:
*   **`project.map`**: Get a high-level overview of the project.
    *   **Usage:** `project.map()`
    *   **Outcome:** Returns a Markdown map of all packages, files, and dependencies. Use this when you first join a project to understand its layout.

go.docs.name: go.docs
go.docs.title: Go Documentation
go.docs.description: Retrieves documentation for a specific Go package. Lists exported types, functions, and variables. Supports returning output in Markdown or JSON format.
go.docs.instruction:
*   **`go.docs`**: Read documentation for a package.
    *   **Usage:** `go.docs(package_path="net/http")`
    *   **Outcome:** Returns a summary of exported symbols and package documentation. Use this to learn how to use a library.

go.build.name: go.build
go.build.title: Go Build
go.build.description: Executes the `go build` command for the specified packages or the current directory. Captures and returns the standard output and standard error to verify compilation status.
go.build.instruction:
*   **`go.build`**: Compile the project to check for errors.
    *   **Usage:** `go.build(packages=["./..."])`
    *   **Outcome:** Returns success or a list of compiler errors. Run this after making edits to ensure you haven't broken the build.

go.test.name: go.test
go.test.title: Go Test
go.test.description: Executes the `go test` command. Supports running tests for specific packages, filtering tests by regex (`-run`), and enabling verbose output or coverage analysis.
go.test.instruction:
*   **`go.test`**: Run tests to verify logic.
    *   **Usage:** `go.test(packages=["./pkg/..."], run="TestAuth")`
    *   **Outcome:** Returns test results (PASS/FAIL). Use this to prevent regressions.

go.install.name: go.install
go.install.title: Go Install
go.install.description: Executes the `go install` command to install packages or binaries to the environment.
go.install.instruction:
*   **`go.install`**: Install a Go tool or package.
    *   **Usage:** `go.install(packages=["golang.org/x/tools/cmd/goimports@latest"])`
    *   **Outcome:** The package is installed to the environment.

go.modernize.name: go.modernize
go.modernize.title: Modernize Go Code
go.modernize.description: Runs the `modernize` analyzer on the codebase to identify and optionally fix legacy Go patterns, replacing them with modern equivalents (e.g., `interface{}` to `any`).
go.modernize.instruction:
*   **`go.modernize`**: Automatically upgrade old Go patterns.
    *   **Usage:** `go.modernize(dir=".", fix=true)`
    *   **Outcome:** Replaces legacy code (e.g., `interface{}`) with modern equivalents (e.g., `any`).

go.diff.name: go.diff
go.diff.title: Check API Diff
go.diff.description: Compares the public API of a Go package between two different versions using the `apidiff` tool. Reports incompatible changes to assess upgrade risks.
go.diff.instruction:
*   **`go.diff`**: Check for breaking API changes.
    *   **Usage:** `go.diff(old="v1.0.0", new=".")`
    *   **Outcome:** Reports incompatible changes in the public API. Use this before upgrading dependencies.

agent.review.name: agent.review
agent.review.title: Code Review Agent
agent.review.description: Submit Go code to an AI reviewer. Returns a structured analysis focusing on correctness, idiomatic style, and potential bugs, with line-specific comments and severity levels.
agent.review.instruction:
*   **`agent.review`**: Request an expert code review.
    *   **Usage:** `agent.review(file_content="...")`
    *   **Outcome:** Returns a list of suggestions, bugs, and style improvements.

agent.specialist.name: agent.specialist
agent.specialist.title: Specialist Agent
agent.specialist.description: Invokes a specialized autonomous agent capable of using investigation tools (read_docs, list_files, inspect_symbol) to answer complex queries about the codebase.
agent.specialist.instruction:
*   **`agent.specialist`**: Ask a complex question that requires investigation.
    *   **Usage:** `agent.specialist(query="How does the authentication middleware work?")`
    *   **Outcome:** The Specialist investigates the code and provides a detailed answer.

agent.master.name: agent.master
agent.master.title: Master Gopher
agent.master.description: Invokes the Master Gopher agent to analyze the user's request and dynamically update the list of available tools to best suit the current task.
agent.master.instruction:
*   **`agent.master`**: Get help deciding which tools to use.
    *   **Usage:** `agent.master(query="I need to refactor the user service.")`
    *   **Outcome:** The Master Gopher selects and enables the best tools for your task.
